rlee348.sounds

Class Player

  • java.lang.Object
    • rlee348.sounds.Player

  • public class Player
extends java.lang.Object
    The Player class implements a simple player for playback of an MPEG audio stream.
    Since:
    0.0.8
    Author:
    Mat McGowan, modified by Ryan Lee

    • Method Detail

      • play

        public void play()
          throws javazoom.jl.decoder.JavaLayerException
        Throws:
        javazoom.jl.decoder.JavaLayerException

      • play

        public boolean play(int frames)
             throws javazoom.jl.decoder.JavaLayerException
        Plays a number of MPEG audio frames.
        Parameters:
        frames - The number of frames to play.
        Returns:
        true if the last frame was played, or false if there are more frames.
        Throws:
        javazoom.jl.decoder.JavaLayerException

      • close

        public void close()
        Cloases this player. Any audio currently playing is stopped immediately.

      • isComplete

        public boolean isComplete()
        Returns the completed status of this player.
        Returns:
        true if all available MPEG audio frames have been decoded, or false otherwise.

      • getPosition

        public int getPosition()
        Retrieves the position in milliseconds of the current audio sample being played. This method delegates to the AudioDevice that is used by this player to sound the decoded audio samples.

      • getAudio

        public javazoom.jl.player.AudioDevice getAudio()

      • setGain

        public boolean setGain(float newGain)
        Sets the volume gain.
        Parameters:
        newGain - Sets the new volume
        Returns:
        true or false depending on if audio is a JavaSoundDevice.
